VMlDdVCpYnQx0SIw3jkMzA.text: Super reasonable price. Home made Thai food. Spicy,  you will love this experience,  Byob

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut soup wroth tofu

w9X8IUWKhvolQqVcRlshWg.text: A great intro to Thai food.  I've never eaten Thai before.  Waitress was very friendly and helpful in guiding me to an awesome first taste - Green Curry.  The decor was neat and clean.  I will be back.  Great food. Great service.  Pleasant decor.

Z9Y3sGV7ltvFC8Fl_-KF8Q.text: The food here is fantastic. Drunken noodles are the best. They are a little pricey but the food is so good I continue to indulge. If the prices were just a little bit lower I would eat here regularly.

jnIlcqIgBOQSwLaW_7GrxA.text: I absolutely loved the drunken noodles. I ordered it with vegetables and it was loaded with peppers, corn, green beans, mushrooms, all kinds of veggies as opposed to just a ton of onions and a few sad looking veggies (I'm looking at you Thai cuisine). I got takeout and was amazed that my food was still face of the sun hot by the time I got home. The noodles were firm and perfectly covered in a sauce that was spicy enough to make every pore in my face sweat. The spicy basil beef was also good but not as fantastic as the drunken noodles. Be forewarned that if they don't ask you for a spicy level that it is going to make you sweat. So if a ton of heat isn't your thing, you need to tell them. Since this is so much closer to one of the places I work, this maybe become my new go to for drunken noodles!  A quick note, check your bag before you leave. They forgot my samosas :-/ and partly my fault for not checking. The decor is relaxing and surprisingly nice for a strip mall. Indoors seats about 20 and they have a couple tables outside if you don't mind major car noise from the very busy Babcock.

BTL-AX4zDZ1Jh34zi7YoZg.text: Red Orchid is delicious and the service is great. We've been there multiple times and we always have a great experience.

omXD9O2JqgY3IpPCYvM3Bw.text: We ate here when it first opened and recalled it as just okay. Tonight we decided to give it another go - and it was really good. We got the chicken pad thai and green curry (vegetables) and both of us really liked our dishes. The spice level was also hotter than I remembered (I'm usually between a 6-8), mine was a 7 and it was very spicy. Portion sizes were also good.

_uFTcTazD9QcKtEZ59dR6A.text: Pretty good food and service here. I usually get the pad Thai with chicken and my husband likes the mossaman curry. The appetizers are good too. Generous portion sizes. BYOB. Small interior so there may be a wait.

moO5qo6BGiNyB1cI9OxNQg.text: We had heard about this place opening from another Thai food lover that we know and we have to say that we are happy to have found somewhere different and new.    I still love my favorite places, but we always like to explore and this was one of those times that exploring was great and we ended up satisfied.  I had the drunken noodle, and it was scrumptious!  A little spicy, but scrumptious.  I just know that their spice levels are a little different than those that I am used to.    Quick service, cute ambiance, and great portions for the cost.  I would highly recommend trying the Red Orchid!

g7qkFFwc_taeZbXIEqKPcw.text: Red Orchid has been a very welcome addition to my take out repertoire. I adore Thai food and was anxious to try this place after randomly having Red Orchid's spring rolls as a free sample at my gym after they first opened. Kind of a strange introduction to them, but knowing we could easily grab some yummy take out on the way home from the gym is appealing.  I've really liked and enjoyed the dishes I've tried here. I obviously gravitated towards the Pad Thai initially, and it's quite tasty. They prepare their tofu expertly, lightly crispy, never mushy or spongy as I've experienced other places. I've tried a handful of dishes since my first visit, but the standout to me is the Drunken Noodles. The rice noodles are homemade and extra fat, soaking in deep flavors of chili paste, basil and bell peppers. It has some serious heat even when I order a 4 spice level! Yum. This is definitely my go to dish here.  The portions are good, usually enough left over for lunch the next day. And the leftovers always reheat well. Prices are around $10-14 for dinner entrees, which it think is average compared to other Thai places in the area. I've eaten in their cute dining room twice, one for lunch and most recently for dinner. While our dinner service wasn't the most prompt initially, our food came out quickly once we were able to order and we got to meet the owner. Lunch portions are smaller but came with soup and salad, both of which were quite yummy.  If you are a Thai fan, this place should definitely be on your radar!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Param tofu special
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House salad
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Summer rolls

CLjzs1ggL7B0sw5ERZ4BGw.text: Good thai food in the area. Friendly staff, have only got take out but since they remodeled, waiting to go in for dinner and byob.

q2f7u6SQ5VE3HQmKFSSJNQ.text: Amazing combinations of flavor with fresh ingredients lovingly prepared by official thai people. This place is wonderful for the escape from the ordinary to the extraordinary.  Not for the meat and potatoes guy. These delicate flavors require a more sophisticated palette.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mango Tilapia. Teriyaki chicken and Thai field rice.
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Samosa yum.
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai-ced Tea! Sweet!

CAeBofscmOySEeDZFTv5PQ.text: My first time here and I'm glad I found it.  Had the Tom yum soup and glass noodle salad.  Both level 4 spicy.  Wow, I don't think I could have handled a 6.  Tom yum soup was tasty and fresh as was the noodle salad. Service was prompt and attentive even though it was busy.  I will be back soon.  Thanks!

6Y2yFySDegZNkcNJ6QKl9g.text: Cozy little place in a strip mall in the North Hills of Pittsburgh.  I never had   Thai food, but was eager to try. I ordered shrimp pad Thai .  It was everything and more.  Generous shrimp. Veggies, and homemade rice noodles - yes, homemade!!   Their hotness scale went  from 1-10 with 10 being extreme.  I ordered a 4 , and was very happy. It had a nice kick.  Dinner was 13.95.  Very happy.  Expect to visit it again.

fDzg1qYGbIlhI1_x39dLyg.text: This is my favorite place for thai in Pittsburgh. I really enjoy their fresh rolls with tofu. The sauce that comes with the rolls is always so delicious.   I usually get the spicy basil with tofu. The vegetables that come with it are always fresh and in a delicious sauce. They always do a great job with the tofu, which is crisp but not too oily. I dislike overly squishy tofu but at Red Orchid the tofu is always great. I usually get brown rice with my dish which seems to be a mix of lovely hearty brown rice with some black rice mixed in. Whatever it is, I always really enjoy it.  I always find my food delightfully spicy but I occasionally get a bite that overwhelms me. So proceed with caution unless you can really handle spiciness!

myqgKpoGhoWB5pCj6YCX4A.text: Called to order take-out from the lunch menu at 3:30 PM and was told they decided to arbitrarily end serving lunch now (goes until 4PM on the menu) but that I could order off the (much higher priced) dinner menu now if i would like.  I asked if I had misunderstood their hours, and they made it sound like I was the one being unreasonable. Inconsistency seems to be the theme with this place -  I have stopped by multiple times during their "open hours" to see that they are just randomly closed with no message on their website and no message on their phone.  These are all service issues. I will say that when I have ordered, the food quality was very good, fairly priced, and well-sized portions.   However, these service problems may spell the end of my Red Orchid days.......

54YzzQipVzViRSHaKx3J_Q.text: This place is a hidden gem. Authentic Thai cooking. Very cute patio, could bring some wine and have a delicious dinner date with friends. Must say that the steam from cooking ended up making everyone sneeze and cough at one point due to some hot pepper vaporizing but it just added to the experience. Quick to go option as well.

bSEJ2jdnsyU3zpXGLxpPGA.text: This place has really, really good food. And the service is very good. The ginger meal is outstanding.

a152wPToz-Tgwq9kW7nSSw.text: Would give it 4.5 stars if possible.  It deserves more than the average 4 star on Yelp.  I feel 5 stars should be deserved for the best of the best.    That being said I think that  it is possibly the best Thai in Pittsburgh.  I have to say Pittsburgh because I've not experienced much Thai elsewhere, and that's also why I feel it is probably a 4.5 ( I'm rambling and probably not making any sense).  I go out of my way to order from here, and they are one of the few places in the area that serve Drunken Noodles.  The one thing to be careful about is the spice level it is never consistent, which as a person who enjoys spicy food it isn't a bother, but I on this most recent trip I ordered a level 5dish, a level 6 and a level 7.  The consensus was that the level 5 was hotter than the 7 and all three were too hot for the other people consuming the dish....which worked out for me cause I got all the leftovers.    On this most recent trip I ordered the following: 1.  Chicken Spicy Rad Ka Prao - I'm not sure the difference between this and regular Pad Thai, but it was great. 2.  Chicken Panang Curry - the "To Go" portion was filled with delicious curry sauce, too much for the rice that was given, but the sauce was the perfect blend of sweat and spicy.  This may have over taken the Drunken Noodles as my favorite dish here. 3.  Pork Bangkok Romen - Another good dish, all the pork and veggies were all chopped up.  I thought since it was romen (I know its not rAmen) it would be a noodle dish.  It comes with rice.  I liked the flavor, but would have preferred it with noodles.

0ZiggZFvzHk3sqpWXiBjDg.text: Yummy food (my favorite is green curry), big open space since they expanded to the next unit, and friendly service. We bring our kid here when it's not too busy and it's great.

Ovw8MtnlfDrkyRvQU4uiHQ.text: After having disappointing food a month ago, we came back....BAD IDEA.. WE WERE THE ONLY PEOPLE THERE AND GOT POOR SERVICE.  We had to ask for refills of water, to take our order, for a container -to -go and our bill. Nobody came around to check on our food. Terrible!  Breading  on fish is not the same as they used to use. It is bland and tasteless.   the crab .rangoons were overcooked, had a starchy floury debris on them and the filling was different than in the past and full of sugar.  Ruined my day, complete waste of money  The soups here used to be superb about 6 months ago. Now they are watered down and flavorless  Go elsewhere

-GHlJ6FSJMIahVuvopv_2A.text: You can order online from their website; however, I went to pick up my order at the stated pick up time and was told the online ordering system was down and they did not get the order. Nonetheless, they apologized and quickly prepared our order in about 10-15 minutes. No big deal.   I had the green curry on a spice level of 5 which was perfect, super tasty. My boyfriend had the pad Thai which was pretty good as well, although I've had better.  Based on the food, I'd give it a 4. I will just be sure to call next time to place an order instead of using the website.

zb096J_wqENq0jJzUSszGQ.text: My husband & I haven't had Thai food in a while and had yet to come to this place even though we live so close! I have to say I was completely won over at the first taste of the Tom Kha soup. The broth was amazing and you could request how spicy you want it. Because it was our first time there, my hubby and I asked for level 5 for all our dishes. Five was a little too spicy for us with the soup hubby got Tom Yum w/ Shrimp, but seemed fine for our entrees (Yellow Curry w/ Chicken and Pad Thai Shrimp).   Our waitress was very helpful and recommended the proteins for our soups based on how they are typically prepared in Thailand which I appreciated bc I enjoy learning what is custom for the culture.  I did request more variety of vegetables in my curry and I definitely got plenty. I could barely eat 1/3 of what they prepared so I have awesome leftovers! Wish I had taken pics.   They have applied for a liquor license so no drinks yet but you can BYOB with a $5 corking fee. Also, it used to be a very small place but they have expanded and have a nice, spacious, eclectic dining area. Go...you won't be disappointed.

4W0VRFwpzlyoYiCvXTeOPA.text: Red Orchid is a gem for realz.  I haven't had the pleasure of eating in yet, but my carryout has been on point each and every time.  The prices are affordable, and the food is SUPER tasty.  I especially love the noodle dishes!  You honestly can't go wrong with the drunken noodles - I recommend trying them with beef.  Your mouth will thank me later!  Seriously though.  The noodles are always perfectly cooked, and there are tons of sprouts, thai basil leaves, and red peppers for you to enjoy.  FYI:  They don't gip you on the meat!    I've also tried the Pad Thai, Pad Ka Prao, and Panang Curry!  They were ALL delicious in their own way.  The chef at Red Orchid is legit!  Mad flavor in every dish I've had thus far.  I'm looking forward to trying more of their menu!  I've heard good things about their apps.  Anywho, if you're looking for good thai food, make sure to hit this place up!  I can (almost, haha) guarantee you'll like the food.  OH, and when they ask you for your spice preference, be careful!  They don't mess around with their heat *grins*

hVCYRJUVAOdWIZqgln1tgQ.text: Service was quick for take out and drunken noodles were good. Stay away from calamari... $7+ for 7 over fried ring that are pencil thin.

_3kvD_A9hqlJPXj0EwLCXA.text: We had the drunken noodles with pork and the pad ka prao with chicken.  My noodles I ordered a 5 and my so ordered his a 7.  Definitely respect the heat scale!  I like spicy stuff and a 5 was more than enough!  Great flavor, really fresh pork in my dish, nicely cooked noodles. They didn't have Thai coffee when I ordered it, and Coke was served out of a (dirty) can for $2.00. Only negatives would be the drink situation.

fIN0hYpl20b4VHyx-KfFjA.text: We had three appetizers.  The chicken satay, pot stickers, and shrimp rolls!  All were "on point"!  So glad we came in while in town.  We now have a Thai place to go to when we're here.  Staff is super friendly and very attentive.

YFLfthewqXGV-nufAZdPgg.text: We went to Red Orchid on a Saturday afternoon for lunch, and I was really impressed with their food because the flavors and spice level were near perfect, and the portions and price for lunch were a great deal.    To start off, we ordered the Red Orchid Combination Sampler #2 which comes with 2 summer rolls, 2 spring rolls (fried), fried tofu, and thai samosas with a few different dipping sauces.  The samosas were unexpectedly sweet but delicious.  The Red Orchid samosas are filled with sweet potatoes and spiced with curry spices and cinnamon accompanied by a cucumber dipping sauce.  For my entree, I had the Drunken Noodles (Pad Kee Mao) with tofu - I had forgotten how much I love this dish and Red Orchid's version was the best that I've had in years - it is stir fried rice noodles in a spicy chili sauce with basil, napa, bean sprouts, and bell peppers.  My partner got the Spicy Basil (Pad Ka Prao) with beef which he really enjoyed - the dish is stir fried with thai chilis, garlic, bell peppers, onion, bamboo shoots, green beans, and basil.  Based on the quality and the tastiness of the food, we will definitely be back.    Another attractive reason to come here is that there is plenty of open, comfortable seating where you don't feel like you are on top of the other diners, plus there is ample parking because the restaurant is in a small strip of businesses/shops on Babcock Blvd - a lot of other Thai restaurants that we frequent are nightmares for parking which is why we usually opt for take-out, so it will be nice to have a great Thai place to go to where we can sit down and enjoy our food right from the kitchen.

mNoU2c_cdBQM3B2Vd1F3QQ.text: Currently sitting third on my favorite Pittsburgh-area Thai restaurant list (behind Smiling Banana Leaf and Nicky's), Red Orchid is an unassuming little place. The atmosphere is really welcoming and nicely decorated. The service is excellent and everyone is incredibly nice.  There aren't a lot of tables, but they do a good job of giving everyone space until it's absolutely necessary to sit people next to you in such a tight space. The prices are also very reasonable.  Overall, the food is good. I've really only tried their noodle dishes so far (pad thai, pad see ew, and pad kee mao) and a few appetizers. The flavor of their pad thai is similar to Nicky's, but the Red Orchid uses a thinner rice noodle. The thin noodles are really the only downside. The other noodle dishes are also good, though, and I'm looking forward to trying some of their other dishes.  Red Orchid is definitely a place worth checking out...especially if your'e in the North Hills and are looking for a respite from all of the overly-busy, predictable restaurants. It's BYOB and the atmosphere makes it a great date night spot. Enjoy...

DKn23C4V9dZhH9F0COP2ew.text: My husband and I ordered take out on a whim. He got the Chicken Basil, I got the Avocado Salad and we ordered a side of Chicken Summer Rolls. Our total was $30.00 which is no big deal for two meals and a appetizer but boy, I was surprised by the portion. The Summer Rolls totaled almost $6.00 and we had two small rolls in the box. I thought maybe the taste would make up for  the portion but alas, I was also disappointed by the bland taste. My salad was a bit measly- store mixed lettuce, a couple tomatoes and slices of avocado. They weren't lying about the name, I will give them that. The dressing was the best part of the whole thing. It was a peanut butter based dressing and surprisingly good on a salad but definitely didn't fill me up. Also, I think I could have made myself a bigger portion for around the same amount of money- $9.00. My husband's Chicken Basil was indeed tasty but small. He asked for spicy level number 9 and they did deliver the expectation of spice. The chicken and vegetables were tender.  I would like to give this restaurant another shot but perhaps sit in and explore the menu more. The interior design of the building is beautiful and is surprisingly big on the inside.  Although I ordered some items that did not live up to my expectations(but maybe they are too high), I would still recommend.

t7lHYWlimE5kwU8Mf3LL9A.text: My husband and I love Red Orchid for dinner.  My parents always request we eat there when they are in town.  I love their appetizer combo.  I typically get Cashew Tofu dish and my husband loves the curries.  Oh! Do yourself a favor and get the ginger tea.  Honestly, amazing.  I do also go to Nicky's on the North Side and find both places comparable.  One is close to my house and one is close to my work.  Can't go wrong with Red Orchid

op63-1YOlYeIk6RllNJO-w.text: Update 08/2015. No longer recommended! This place managed to ruin their otherwise tasty cooking. Our recent visits and take aways of several curries were all very salty. They also cheat on their sample appetizers: 2 pieces were actually 1 whole sliced into 2. The noodles were all sugary. ---- At par with Thai Gourmet, Thai Tamarind, or Smiling Banana. They have been consistent on the heat level, however inconsistent in sweetness (red and green curries occasionally too sweet). Also, they use canned sweetened pineapple, which ruins fresh taste. Overall nonetheless, good tasting Thai food, they do not fail on their noodles. Their best entrees are Wild Curry and Duck Curry.

dzB70rm65lIre7c06aU19g.text: I've now given Red Orchid two chances, and have been disappointed both times.  I ordered the vegetable pad see ew each time, and even with some spice, I can't say there was much flavor compared to others I've had.  My biggest problem is that for the price, portions are rather small.  ***Update: Against my better judgment, gave this place one more shot.  Ordered online - got there 20 mins later as stated on my confirmation page, and my order had not been started...I was told it wasn't even received.  I officially give up.

DzFou7YyFBNR6nrNZ2CNVQ.text: I am done!  I keep trying to go back but no more!  I ordered a Pad Kee Mow level 2 and a Pad See Ew level 5.  The 2 was hotter than the 5!  I couldn't even eat it.  It is easily an 8 or 9 somewhere else.  I'll stick with Nikki's or Thai Cafe!!

9CNIdbfJzJlLKIoQXiKcCw.text: I used to go & enjoy this place. Don't know what happened:( the service was terrible. She only had 1 table & that was ours. No smile & completely ignoring us.

uTeESVtahRw5wht6xX7gvw.text: I had basically reserved myself to the fact that I wasn't going to get delicious and authentic Thai food in Pittsburgh, let alone the North Hills. All of my love and memories of amazing Thai food remained back in graduate school, many years ago. Adding to all of this was that Mr. J. is not much of a fan of Thai food. To my surprise, he actually found this place via Yelp and we decided to give it a try.   First bonus is that you can order online for takeout. No, they don't deliver,  but this is a pretty cool feature of the website. I had the Tom Yum soup and Massaman curry. The soup was so flavorful and full of fresh, crisp veggies! I ordered it as a spice level 1 and it was just spicy enough for me. The massaman curry was creamy and thick, with tender chicken, potatoes,  carrots, and peanuts.....memories of graduate school come flooding back.   Mr. J. ordered the Bangkok Romen. It was very similar to lo mein, but they had forgotten to toss it in the brown sauce before packing it up. Even sauceless,  it was good. A shot of sriracha and soy sauce gave it the additional moisture and flavor it was missing.   I'd like to go back and dine in. While very good, I do think there was something lost during transportation. Take out is never as good as fresh from the kitchen.

4K0jZqj-9fI0TH390wlw6A.text: Food is fresh, authentic and reasonably priced. Always fast service and friendly staff! Should be more busy than it is!

fnz9Nyou50yhX9NlNsKxcg.text: I had takeout from here this past Friday evening with my girlfriend.  We had decided to get food from here the night before whenever we were on our way home from dinner we noticed a sign for this place at the corner of Babcock and Three Degree Road.  We decided to give it a try it since we both enjoy Thai food and there prior to this there had been no authentic Thai food in the North Hills.  It was definitely an experience trying to order from here since there was no menu online at the time due to their website being under construction and also because we had never seen the place before.  However we decided to go with some classic Thai dishes that they would be sure to have and so I ordered a beef red curry while my girlfriend ordered the pad thai.  Without knowing how spicy their food was going to be and after a slight misstep of a overly spicy 10 order in Vegas, I decided to be reasonable with a 6 while my girlfriend went with a 1. She was nice enough to pick up the food while I was out running a local 5K and so I was unable to see the place for myself.  My girlfriend did say that the place seemed quaint and that it also looked like it was BYOB.  My beef red curry came with the traditional items of baby corn, bamboo shoot and leaf (basil or kaffir) as well as an ample side of rice.  The curry tasted nice and spicy while also displaying a somewhat sweet flavor which I really enjoyed.  My girlfriends Pad Thai also had a good taste to it which she enjoyed.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here in the future.  I  thought that their food was good and I am interested to actually see and eat in the restaurant.  It is also exciting that the North Hills finally has a True Thai restaurant!

SIKgwEN9I4XwGntn5z6PqA.text: Went to Red Orchid on a Thursday night, no one else was in the restaurant.  I slowly realized most people place to-go orders because everyone was stopping by on there way home from work.  They new exactly what they wanted, regulars...a good sign.    I had the pad thai and their coconut soup.  Both were good, not grand, but good.  I have been craving pad thai and since I recently moved to Pittsburgh hadn't been to a thai restaurant here.  I would also order food from here after work like everyone else.  I wouldn't consider it a date night, but rather some thai comfort food.  No complaints.  Just thai food, plain and simple.

ZF3sNNuDMXAl1jJPCkp8DQ.text: Has anyone noticed that when a crowd of Yelpers gathers the discussion inevitably turns to "the best Thai in Pittsburgh?" What a lively discussion, too! My vote for the category? Definitely the Red Orchid in the tiny, little, difficult to get into (and out of) strip mall on Babcock Boulevard in Ross. The risk of those very necessary Mario Andretti sharp, quick left turns are definitely worth it!   Why? Let's start with Tom Yum and Tom Kha soups. Rich, spicy and totally satisfying kissed with lemongrass, kaffir lime and galangal with just the right heat. I ordered a 5 on a scale of 10 and it was just right for my heat-loving palate. If you're not a fan of heat, I'd go tamer than what you think would be a medium heat of 5. It was definitely more of a 7...and I like that!  Green Curry is my Thai food yardstick. I measure every new Thai restaurant by the quality of their green curry because it's my go-to favorite dish. The good news is I found Green Curry heaven at the Red Orchid! Spicy, yet sweet with coconut, crunchy green beans and silky eggplant made an especially flavorful curry with basil as the accent. I love that they give you the choice of jasmine rice or brown rice! And the portions are huge!  Kimber raved over the Wild Curry. She too likes her food spicy and ordered a 6. I really don't think there was much of a Scoville Scale difference between a 5 and a 6. I truly didn't see (or taste) much difference in flavor or ingredients between my Green Curry and Kimber's Wild Curry either...but both were delicious.  The Red Orchid is on my way home from work. Why mention that? It means I can place an order to pick up take out to eat in my jammies in front of the TV. Score! The last time I did that, Drunken Noodles (Pad Kee Mao) was the choice. Oh my goodness! I know Pad Thai is the national dish, but the wide rice noodles with chicken, napa cabbage, basil and lots of spicy red pepper paste won me over. Not that I'm abandoning Pad Thai mind you. Other faves have been appetizers of grilled Nam Tok (beef) with lime, cilantro and sticky rice and Chicken Satay with yellow curry or entrees of Spicy Basil Fried Rice and Spicy Green Beans.   The restaurant is lovely...and tiny with only 24 seats. Get there early or you may have to wait - this place is popular! Maybe it has to do with the fact that when the owner moved here from Thailand (a tsunami wiped out her restaurant there), she cooked at the Bankok Balcony, Nicky's Thai Kitchen and the Smiling Banana Leaf too, before opening up her very own restaurant in the North Hills. Keson knows Pittsburgh Thai-loving palates. Thanks Keson, for bringing GREAT Thai food to the North Hills!

XijEG3EQfpgWDMn2JmJbyw.text: Delicious and thentic Thai food with your choice of spicyness?  East to find seats now that the dining room has grown.  Fantastic pineapple curry.

yqzurqdLNeKaxzY0rtjsaA.text: Now we finally have a much-needed authentic Thai restaurant in the North Hills area!   Unlike one of the other so-called Thai restaurants (in Wexford), this restaurant has great food, decent prices (you're not paying for pretentious decor, fancy lighting, and a trendy bar), and excellent service.   Just tried it today (9/8/12) and found it to be very pleasant.  Pad see eew was outstanding, pad thai and panang curry were also excellent.   Very friendly and accommodating staff.  Lunch specials are $7.50 and include soup or salad... nice presentation of the food.  Pleasant restaurant environment and nice decor/atmosphere (very clean yet and nice Thai decor yet without the pretentious bells and whistles), although small interior so there's not a lot of seating.   As mentioned by others a bit hard to locate (just south of 3 Degree Road intersection on Babcock, near Sherwin-Williams paint store), but once you find it you'll keep coming back.  We will definitely be going there regularly.

j9LXD41LY8TTykWUQFCQtw.text: WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's for sure the last time being there. I've been there several times and the service is just getting worse and worse! The waitress there can barely undetstand English and VERY VERY RUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!! AIR IN THIS RESTAURANT IS SUPER INTENSE! Sitting there without even water for like 20mins, wait for 40mins for food. Food there is not bad, but because of the service I will tell anyone I know NEVER NEVER NEVER GO THERE EVER!!!!!!!!!!! It just ruined my whole day!!!!!!!!

fUzXt4a2b65alP4GWsA57A.text: Licking sweaty armpits would taste better. My husband and I love Thai & have been to almost every one in Pittsburgh. This, without a doubt, was a supreme disappointment. We were soooo excited to have a place in the North Hills (Thai Place......meh). Got take out. First time, they jacked up my order by giving me rice instead of noodles on my 'Drunken NOODLES' and it was so hot that it was inedible (asked for a 5 & I'm no wimp). Husband's was do nasty that he wouldn't eat it. How do they mess up tofu and veggies? By dumping some orange marmalade junk on it. Also, app was wrong. We let some time go by & decided to try again a few weeks ago. Again, takeout. I spoke slowly & even asked her to repeat it back & told her our last order was wrong (I was polite). Husband gets back, my noodles, yes noodles, were there.....success, right? Ha! I asked for a 1..so spicy that I felt like the dude on Man vs. Food during a ghost chili challenge. Again, my husband's was terrible and, wait for it....they messed up the app. Two tries, will try no more. With food like this, they'll be gone in months.

S8u9JvIiqru7lWHr4R6rHA.text: Really enjoyed this Thai restaurant. Drunken noodles are among the best I've tasted! A tiny bit too spicy - even though I only ordered a 4, but still delicious! Can't wait to go back when we're in the area.

5k8xTCKuR6MW8--jAx7owQ.text: What a welcome addition to the North Hills!  Red Orchid is located in a small shopping center where Sherwin Williams and an Indian Market are located.  The food is great...I have had the spring rolls, some of the curry dishes, and drunken noodles.  I find the "spicy levels" to be a little hotter than other places - so take note.  I love the food!  Nice selection of desserts too and the sticky rice and mango is great!  The women that have opened this place have done a great job with a small space.  It is my new "weekly" place to eat.

q91t5ftMZvlaO8Jqt1WcfA.text: I called from 7 to 720 tonight to place a take out order. Busy signal every time. Came in to place a take out order and not one person in the restaurant. Great food. Horrible at running a restaurant.

hGM6Y232K-BJCLaE6Oh7Yg.text: Should have listened to the warnings about spice level. My level 3 was hotter than my husband's level 6. I was unable to eat my dinner because it was too hot. The taste was good but next time I'll order a level 1 and hope for the best.

lvi_1lPwTirsX0psOV442g.text: The food is amazing. Very clean restaurant and the pad tai is out of this world good.

YiJSQCkk6sT2-suPfD2FTg.text: I've eaten here three times and each time it's been great. The Masaman and Panang Curry are both delicious and full of flavor. I also love the crab rangoons. They're done perfectly and not overly battered.

jH39-da1t1aWVqIwtUr7kA.text: Waited over 2 hours for my order to be delivered.  Paid for delivery and after an hour of  waiting called to check on order. Was told my food has been ready for an hour, when I inquired on why it has t been delivered was advised should be delivered in another 30 mins. Waited over 2 hours

cUF87h73j6vTCs6tAke96Q.text: My quest to eat at all the Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh landed me next at Red Orchid. I was intrigued to read about the owner having opened a restaurant in her native Thailand only to have it wiped out by the tsunami. What brought her to Pittsburgh I have no idea but I'm super glad she's here!! Man, this was good! She's worked at Bangkok Balcony, Smiling Banana Leaf, and Nicky's Thai - all good resume material if you ask me!  While not the easiest place to find, this little restaurant is very nice inside and gives a different vibe than many others with the cloth table settings, the cute pendant lighting, and the soothing feel it all generates. The menu is very thorough and has dozens of things I love. We started with the fresh tofu summer rolls which were very good. You could tell that all the ingredients were indeed fresh because the flavor profile was outstanding. Next came soup or salad - I had a salad with a homemade pineapple dressing (delightful!) and my wife had the rice soup - which isn't at all bland like you might think based on the name. It was very tasty!  My spicy pork basil ordered, surprise, Thai hot was indeed Thai hot!! YUM YUM YUM!!! And wow, the flavors were amazing! Just like I hoped they would be! The pork was tender and skillfully prepared and the veggies were so obviously fresh and super tasty. Man, I'd order that again in a heartbeat! My wife ordered the Lad Nah which had the stir fried wild rice noodles (DELIGHTFUL!) with an assortment of fresh vegetables and a delicious brown sauce. So good! My daughter's masaman curry was superb as well and just the right hint of sweetness from the coconut milk.  I was pleasantly surprised at how good this was! Count me in as a fan and as someone who will be back again and again! And yep, I agree, this is more like a 4.5 star place. It's that good. Worth finding for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork spicy basil. Thai hot of course!! Super tasty!!!!

3oPN0zqHcfegF_OPCa2Vig.text: Beware when you sit across from me and order something ridiculously delicious. You may get stabbed by my fork or in the case of my vegetarian daughter, assaulted by my 'non-tainted clean" utensils! Fortunately for both my husband and my daughter during our lunch  at Red Orchid my husband ordered his Pork Spicy Basil dish 'Thai Hot' and my daughter ordered the Massaman Curry that was loaded with potatoes (eh, Mom can do without potatoes but, dang that sauce was to die for) or I would have been obnoxiously dipping into their food across the table.  My Lad Nah with big honking handmade rice noodles and tons of veggies (including baby corn that tasted fresh - serious bonus!!!) in a yummy brown sauce with tons of flavor was pretty perfect. I ordered a 6 heat that was probably more of a 4-5, but I'm so not being picky about that because every bite was delectable.   The fact that the owner lost her first restaurant in Thailand during the tsunami and miraculously found her home in Pittsburgh working at one of my all time favorite Thai restaurants (Nickys!) among others, only makes me happier to discover this cute little place on Babcock Blvd. in the heart of the North Hills.   I look forward to returning regularly and perhaps revising my review upward after I taste a few more of the delights coming out of this happy Thai kitchen!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drunken Noodles with Pork
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lad Nah with chicken, veggies and rice noodles
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lunchtime special Rice Soup

3ZY5WpRXQN60d3-mtMo8Qg.text: I love spicy food but watch out!! My friend and I ordered drunken noodles and thai basil beef -- figured since we are asian we can handle hot. (They offer a 1 to 10 spectrum) We got 4 and we were sweating and almost crying. Definitely should have been more conservative with our spicy spectrum.   We ordered a side of steamed veggies and it wasn't very fresh. There were dark colors on the carrots.  Portions were decent and the price for dinner was typical. Abour $12-13 for an entree. They have your typical Thai food offerings: pad thai, drunken noodles, green curry..etc. The service was a little slow but there was only 1 person serving / waiting on tables inside.   Ordered the Thai Ice Tea and it was delicious. We also ordered the sticky mango rice dessert and it was good to share with a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh Spring rolls

ntV3c8FUivH_wtlN4e--ig.text: I have been going to the Red Orchid since 2012 and I have recommended it to local friends and friends visiting the city, all who have grown to love it just as much as I do. I have been to Thai restaurants along the east coast, and by far, this is the best Thai I have ever had.   Not only is the food authentic as it gets, the owners and staff are so friendly that when I was going through a hard time in my personal life, the waitress who I came to know over the years hugged me and gave me so many kind words. Aside from that they have expanded! They now have a liquor license and they are better than ever.   Dishes I would recommend:  Green Curry-To DIE for. The green curry has broccoli and the most perfect coconut milk in it with a side of rice. All the curries are delicious,  but this is my favorite. Get a level 1-2 spicy if you are beginner with Thai cuisine.   Drunken noodles- My second favorite dish. I must have ordered this dish 30 times over the past few years. The noodles are thin, wide, and so flavorful. I love the bean sprouts, green and red peppers, as well as the chicken I add.   Spicy Tom Yum Soup- My sister's favorite! It's really creamy, yet has the perfect balance of spiciness and flavor. Normally wouldn't order a soup for an entree but it really is filling.   Drink- Can't go wrong with a Thai iced tea. I wouldn't get an entree without it. It's sweet and balances out the spiciness from the entree.   Mango with sticky rice- A light, yet divine dessert to a wonderful meal.   Overall, my favorite restaurant has never failed me or my friends/ acquaintances. I would recommend it to anyone!

lNgHdm2W2eoziXLwwIsr1w.text: I ordered take out, so I can only speak for that, but I didn't love my food. I ordered the Pad Thai lunch special and everything was bland and mushy and greasy at the same time. It was quick and convenient, and I was starving, so I ate it, but I won't be returning.

EgbolnNxz4nwNKxosjcejA.text: If you want authentic Thai food, this is the place to go.  This and Nicky's in the city are the ony Thai restaurants I would trust around pittsburgh.  The food is delicious, the workers are attentive, the servings are big enough for sharing.  Try to save room for dessert, too.  I love their mango sticky rice.  It's also a BYOB place.  Some cons: it's a small space and a little difficult to find if you're not familiar with the area.  Otherwise worth the drive.

SSdE5v63OOWxTgLPpeZfgg.text: The Red Orchid is a fast flight to South East Asia. If you want ro recall a trip, this is the best place to go. I orderes a Yellow Curry, spicy level 6 (exactly the same flavours and spyciness than Thailand) while my aunt ordered the Pad Thai. Both dishes were amazing and large. We had the shrimp rolls, totally recommendable, completely fresh. I loved it and totally will go back!!!

GDlsJ--sgfxXuJ9SsoTYoA.text: The food was delicious and plentiful. The heat index was high, I requested a red curry with a 3 heat index, just perfect but still made my nose sniffle. Wife had Drunken Noodles with shrimp, incredible flavor and texture. The pumpkin custard is a must for dessert. The service was a little slow but food was quick.  Nice treasure if you are heading towards Ross Park Mall..

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Fried Rice with Curry
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drunken Noodles with Shrimp
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red Curry Chicken

aE6HRmRmog5N9zvI7xRhPA.text: I've been hearing amazing things about this place so when a friend told me she wanted to try Thai food, I told her this was the place we should go.  A Double Take Deal and BYOB made it easy for her to accept my invitation.  I picked up a bottle of white and we met on a Friday evening to catch up over what we hoped would be a good meal.  We were not disappointed.  In fact, I don't even know if words can express how amazing our night was.  It was one of those magical nights where everything was just so lovely.  My friend and I shared some good conversation (along with that bottle of wine) with each other as well as our dining neighbors who could not have been more delightful.  Our waitress was attentive and we were very pleased with the service.  The food also surpassed my expectations.    While I was overwhelmed by the menu, I was very excited to see several duck items featured.  Not many places offer duck and when they do it is maybe one lone item.  On this night I luckily found Crispy Duck Cashew written on the specials board for the day.  It made my decision easier.  My friend went with the Crispy Chicken Cashew special and we started with an order of the fried spring rolls.  Our meals were delightful and we were enjoying ourselves so much that I ordered dessert.  After seeing the sticky black rice with pumpkin, I could not say no.  It was definitely the right decision.  I'd like to go back for more.  Perhaps to try one of the salads or soups.  I've learned to be careful when ordering a spice level, though.  4 is about as much as I can handle.  All in all, I say the atmosphere created by Red Orchid is definitely gong worthy!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Black Sticky Rice with Pumpkin
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy Duck Cashew
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oEdHFcvmonyjWCLGsIBNqg.text: Our new favorite place for Thai! We currently have a couple favorites in the city but I love that this one is close to home.   The location itself is small and in a strip mall on Babcock Blvd. Typically when I think of a restaurant in a strip mall I don't consider it to be anything fancy. Red orchid did a great job making their restaurant feel elegant. I personally loved the table runners and fresh flowers.   The food was delicious! I loved that they offered a variety of options and that curry fried rice was one of them! We ordered crab rangoons and my husband said that they are his new favorite in the city. He liked the mixture of sweet and a little bit of spicy.   They use a spice scale of 1-10. I traditionally order a 6 but it was a little too spicy for me. Delicious but spicy!   We'll definitely be back and we'll take advantage of the BYOB option.

vqjQ0Nhr_u8cQ3Ufp3FVdg.text: Where has the Red Orchid been all my life? Absolutely delicious! We came here on a random Sunday and I'm so glad we did. The space is nice and they have a few tables for outdoor seating. We were seated right away. The staff is very friendly and efficient. They have a full bar with an ok selection. Nothing crazy craft brew wise, but I good choice of wines and beer. You can still BYOB but there is a service fee. We ordered the fried vegetable spring rolls to start. They came out quickly and we're really yummy. I got the drunken noodles with shrimp. Spicy level 5. It had a nice kick and got my nose running which is exactly what I want. My fiance got Pad Thai with chicken level 3. He doesn't dig the heat like I do but he really enjoyed it. I took a taste and it was great flavor. (I of course would have asked for it hotter, but everyone has their own preferences. ). This is a great spot. Would be great for a group. There were a few families there so kids are welcome. Definitely drop in and get some amazing Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable fried spring rolls
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Drunken Noodles
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai with Chicken

Dc_MKruHlbyKomkMscT2cQ.text: So after having a bad online ordering experience here a few weeks ago, it was a Monday I ordered online and went to pick my food up and there was a note on the door that said the business was closed for the day, so I just opted for the old fashioned phone call. I ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice, at first I asked for the Spice to be 2, then went for Spice at level 3. The woman on the phone was a little hard to understand She asked me a few times did I want soup or salad I said salad, I asked for salad she said something about the dressing, I thought she mentioned ranch so I said yes (turns out it wasn't ranch it's the normal ginger dressing). She said that it would be ready in 15 minutes I went to pick up the food in about 10mins and it was ready. There's a mini seating area on the sidewalk in front of the building I want to say 3 or 4 patio tables. I opened the Styrofoam container and blahhhh it doesn't look half as good as Nicky's Thai, but I won't let that sway my opinion. I tasted it and BAM spice smacked me right in the face, well mouth actually. If you're not too fond of spice get a 1, I actually like spice and asked for a 3 on my Pineapple Fried Rice and I am dying... my eyes are watering and the sides of my tongue are burning. My coworker said her husband usually gets a 10 elsewhere, but here he gets a Level 6 or 7. So beware of the heavy handed cooks! The flavor is okay a little bland, other than the spice of course. It seems like the pineapples are either canned or have just been sitting around a little long, still good. I do love the amount of fried egg they put in I never get enough eggs. I'm comparing it to Nicky's which is both sweet and spicy and I love theirs. I would love to try something different from here though I may try this again with a lighter Spice Level. Their lunch prices are good and you get either soup or salad with your order.   Would I order again yes? But definitely not at Level 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pineapple Fried Rice. Level 3(Extremely Spicy)  $8.25 Lunch special
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side salad that comes with the lunch special. I think it is a ginger dressing.

PKA1U7nYKYmo0y8UZUjYMQ.text: Food is good but the service is really poor. Place is byob but has one of the highest corkage fees in the area. The staff is not friendly and come across as rude and condescending. Advice - avoid dine in and do take outs!

bV5KPeDbvsgcEnzaP8frLA.text: I am officially done saying "I like spicy food" at Thai restaurants. I  ordered the Som Tom (spicy papaya salad) and told the waitress they could prepare it at an "8." For the record, an "8" here may in fact make you sterile.   authentic, delicious and fresh! I'd recommend this place for dates or a small party.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

A715uFSedABxsiDhWtcINQ.text: I have been to Red Orchid once before, and it was really good - but the spice levels are quite humbling.  A spiciness level 3 at Red Orchid is another Thai restaurants level 8 or 9.  Beware, or be prepared to be humbled.  I can confidently say that tonight's visit ranks as the weirdest of bizarro restaurant visits I've experienced in my 20+ years of restaurant dining.  We sit down, and I order a Thai iced tea and him, a water.  We order two Tom Kha soups, mine with shrimp at a spice level of 3 and him a chicken with a spice level of 5.  When they arrive, mine is the level 5 and his is the level 3.  So we send them back.  This time, they arrive and mine is correct but his is shrimp, not chicken.  So we send his back...I eat my soup and by the time that his soup comes, our entrees are in hand too.  He has the drunken noodles with beef, and I have the chicken noodle soup.  His entree is perfect, prepared properly and exactly what he asked for.  My chicken noodle soup on the other hand, is rice noodles in water with white chicken, scallions and cilantro.  Utterly flavorless, short of what little flavor that the chicken meat offers.  So I'm trying to eat this chicken and noodle water with vegetation, because I didn't want to further embarrass myself by sending this soup back after the Tom Kha fiasco.  Unfortunately, I couldn't take it so I asked for some chili pepper oil or something.  So she insists on taking the soup back to have some soy sauce or salt mixed in, which I agree because just want to eat my dinner in peace.  She brings it back and it's not any better.  So my waitress comes back and asks me if I want something else.  I resist, but she insists, so I opted for the drunken noodles that my husband had.  She brings that to the table a few minutes later, asks me how it is - I was thrilled!!! She then tells me that the boss is yelling at her, and motions toward an angry looking woman who is crossing the rear of the restaurant.  I smile, and tell the woman that the drunken noodles are amazing and that I'm very satisfied.   After a little bit, I ask her to box up the noodles since I want to take the rest home.  I ask about the mango sticky rice and she said that the mango is giant eagle because they're out of season.  She encourages me to try one of the more seasonally appropriate desserts even though the mango sticky rice is one of the specials.  I order a thai pumpkin sticky rice and she tells me that she's going to charge me for half of the soup I sent back.  We balk at this since we learned this after she insisted that I ordered something else, and after I've eaten the new dish.  My husband becomes annoyed and speaks up - the waitress informed him that if we don't pay for the dish, she has to.  We weren't understanding this concept, and a second waitress is attracted to the situation in the quiet restaurant.  I'm so embarrassed I want to disappear, when a third waitress comes to the table and informs us that the "boss" charges them for their mistakes and that the waitress was going to have to pay for the two original tom kha mistakes. I'm flabbergasted by the injustice of this knowing that it is against the law for them to do this to an employee since situations like these are the cost of doing business, and also horrified that we're being bullied into paying for something that wasn't our fault, simply because we feel bad for our waitress.    It's not her fault that she's not great at her job, but that's not an appropriate source of cost recovery.  We will think twice about eating there again, and maybe you should too.  Monday, I will be contacting the Pennsylvania Bureau of Labor Law Compliance and the U.S. Department of Labor to report that the "Boss" is doing this to their employees. My waitress goes back to the kitchen to put in my dessert order, and I can hear the boss screaming at her from two rooms away.  It was not a good situation to be in.  What's pretty on the inside isn't always pretty in the kitchen.  Buyer beware.  14 hours later: my husband and I have been sicker than a dog since our visit.  We won't be returning.

TsCEntfOHVYFz1YrrJ-o0A.text: Best Thai food in Pgh! Never greasy and so good. Very spicy- so if you do not like spice I would tell them!

dyDMEb0QcoAiW0SAuRSkbw.text: Amazed I have yet to write a review considering that I've eaten here about 50 times. It is my favorite Thai restaurant and could be the best in Pittsburgh. I've been to silk elephant and a couple Thai restaurants near West Penn hospital as well. I just think that the food is very flavorful, staff is very friendly and attentive, and as of recently they started serving alcohol. The food is inexpensive. Unlike some of the Indian restaurants this place is very spot on with the desired spice level. If you ask for 10/10 it will be spicy. It is one of the few places in my life for which I lack the frustration of not being able to order a dish very very spicy.

wdFfrUckp5pzjge9-t0vJA.text: The atmosphere is great, very clean. Really enjoyed my tom kah soup and crispy duck salad. I'm a baby and mild was just right. Service was fast and attentive.

ETpx28rko_19TGbE_tWBAA.text: Wasn't my favorite pad Thai. Didn't taste right, the flavor was pretty bland. Didn't really like the mint in the spring rolls either. Overall not the best experience but i did get my food pretty fast.

C8hT7VYvUndChaPWmM6SFw.text: Great spot, I've never had bad food here. Their sticky rice and drunken noodles are spot on and affordable. You'll not find better Thai grub in the North Hills region or even Wexford or Cranberry for that matter. Family run!

UZGwEP7-37gDERcZ_0rkOA.text: In terms of convenience it satisfies, but in terms of quality, experience, and value, Nikki's 7-10 minutes away is superior. I ordered the Tom kha soup to start. It was in a soup bowl whereas Nikki's is served in their curry sized dinner bowls (practically a main course in itself). It tasted good except lemongrass seemingly dominated the dish. When I was ready to order my food, I had to walk over and find the waiter who was sitting down watching the World Cup in the other room even though I was the only customer in the establishment. When I received my check, it showed spice level of 0 (he never asked because I always order just 1 below the max), and there was a salad on the bill that I never received. After pointing it out, he appeared surprised that I still wanted it...if it came with the meal, might as well. Lastly, I asked for recommendations of protein pairings with the soup. He said, "same...." and left it at that whereas the folks at Nikki's discuss which courses or curries pair best with each protein. The drunken noodles did taste good, but the pork was very dry. Overall, it was disappointing at the lack of attention I received while being their only business mid afternoon. It terms of portion size, experience, and staff friendliness, I learned to just take the extra few minute drive to mt. Nebo.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

b87kelupWriVBV6q00VH_g.text: My BF and I have been hooked on Red's Orchid's Thai food ever since our first takeout experience. I'd like to rate it a 4.5, if that were an option :) They've recently expanded their dine-in area. We started with, what else other than, the classic default Asian appetizer of Crab Rangoon. My go-to main dish order is the Green Curry with shrimp, which consists of broccoli, green beans, bell peppers, eggplant, basil mixed in a green curry paste & coconut milk. It is delicious, but seriously spicy. I order the lowest spice level at a 1 and it stills instantly makes me cough, my nose run and indigestion instantly flare... but I still LOVE the taste. Seriously it's delicious, even if I can only handle a bit at a time. Usually when I order take out I combat the spice by adding more coconut milk or yogurt. I am sissy when it comes to spicy, but truly even my BF thinks it is spicy for a level 1. Although, I just took my parents here and my Dad ordered a 3 in green curry and it seemed just as spicy as the level 1s I've had. My BF tried something new on a recent trip, the Thai Panang curry with coconut milk prepared with broccoli, carrots and bell peppers. He ordered a spice level 5, so I was too scared to try it myself. My mother recently tried Masaman Curry at $12.50 of potatoes, onions, carrots, mixed in masaman paste in coconut milk. It was delicious creamy, sweet and peanut-y. We also regularly order my other favorite dish, the Pineapple fried rice. It is stir fried with egg, pineapple, cashews, carrots, onion, scallions, and raisins which all combine to create the most delicious nutty flavor. Once I start eating this dish, I have a hard time stopping. I've had it multiple times and once it was a bit too greasy for fried rice. I would really encourage anyone in the North Hills area to step up their takeout experience by ordering from the Red Orchid, or to stop in for the dine-in experience. I've written more on my blog & shared pictures if you are interested at moscatoismymantra.com/ca...

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. green curry noodles with chicken
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. green curry noodles with chicken
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Panang curry with coconut milk prepared with broccoli, carrots and bell peppers.

nPZLbiybN0wl55AEZcpQLg.text: Best curry in Pittsburgh I have found. Fiance is a spicy food junky and this is the only place that understands "twice as spicy as the max" means really spicy. Everywhere else makes that request like a mild habanero spicy at most, but usually not even that. My fiance eats peppers hotter than ghost peppers, and this is the only place that takes his spice requests seriously. I always order pumpkin curry lvl 1 or 2 because I like a mild thai spicy and he gets the green twice as spicy as the max. Please don't ever change, we love you.

qx2txyijTf28JiRnyPpPZQ.text: Really good Thai, excellent for take out pretty good for dine in. Is this the best in Pittsburgh... probably not. Best in the North Hills?... no doubt. Excellent curry, pad Thai, appetizers, and more. You will be very very pleased with your decision to come here and indulge...

CgfMNVwNbIqaTkhY-9NMGQ.text: This is more of a 3.5 star restaurant.  The main thing about this place is that it made everyone I was with cough and sneeze from the unforgiving dry chili powder cooking fumes. I will add that I was here with another Indian couple so even they thought the place smelled oppressively spicy. I usually ask for hot sauce on the side so I can customize my own level of spiciness but this place only gives you a little tin of chili powder. That's as basic as it gets! At Chinese and other Thai restaurants, they give you a side of house-made chili oil sauce or at least Sriracha.   My dish of the Thai chicken ramen was okay but note to self--NEVER order chicken for a dish like this. It just comes out dry, flavorless and cut too big. I've seen this at most places but the price difference was just too high to jump to seafood and also, pork wasn't even an option. Two people order the curries at my table and they looked and smelled great, so clearly, that was what I should have ordered. My friend ordered their crunchy noodle special and it was just DROWNING in sauce. The Hong Kong style of cooking pan fried noodles is to have the noodles themselves remain flavorful and crunchy while a savory, light sauce with stir fried vegetables lightly coats everything. This was not the case here and that dish looked like a mess.   I did like the decor but there definitely needs to be more separation between the heavy kitchen fumes and the dining area. Prices were higher than average and portions are a little above average too (although I managed to finish everything).

LfUAH58ZgPSmRCAkttuIqw.text: Let me first say that we've been going here to eat and ordered take out for a while, and service and food has always been good. Today was a different story when it comes to the service part.  All started with wife calling to order food for take out. Was told it would be ready in about 20 minutes. Stopped to vote on the way, and went to pick up food. Wife walks in to pick it up and is told they have no orders for take out. Wife said she called, where he answered nobody called and he's only one there. Wife shows him the phone where he can see that she called and as this happens an older lady walks out from the back. He says something to her in Thai and she says "oh, I forgot". Obviously she took the order and forgot to turn it in. After waiting for so long, wife finally gets the food, pays and comes back to the car. They did not apologize for any of what took place and did not offer a discount. Will look for different place for good Thai food in the area.

LszxOJc7wdpCyctMmaVoFQ.text: Had the green curry for lunch a few days ago. It was actually really really good, very unique and more sweet and rich than a normal curry. It was definitely spicier than what I was expecting but it really worked. The only thing I felt lacking was the portion size-I ate it all and didn't have any leftovers, which is strange for Thai food but I guess you can't overdo quality!

HUsWAct2bGdyk1efY-gCXA.text: Nice place with friendly staff. We tried the crab rangoon (crispy and thin), pad thai, drunken noodle (very good), and well balanced tom yum soup.

LTR5H3mCGewaW6nBa_2lZg.text: Tom yum soup - this was the only good dish I had compared to the other options I ordered below. I would get this again.   Crispy noodles were not crispy, rather drenched in saw which made the dish look more like a soup. The taste wasn't my style either something was off.   Don't bother with the calamari appetizer. The amount is not worth $7 nor is the taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $7 calamari, chicken tom yum soup
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy noodles, not crispy. Why is it drenched in sauce like a soup??

YJYHI4_P3mznqnysipOaZg.text: Its my go-to place for thai food !   Love all the variety of fried rice. Food is served hot and fresh.  Highly recommend it !

vIaHHu22C_V50tYIu2aA9g.text: Awesome food and friendly staff.  Ordered the pineapple chicken curry, Penang chicken along with Egg rolls and Tom Kha soup.   Fresh ingredients and full of flavor.  Very authentic.  Beautiful restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Penang chicken

R2ZUuB815ibryqUrlbznTw.text: I love this place! The food is reasonable priced and the portions are big. The menu has a wide variety of food from soup noodle bowls to different types of curries.  I love the tom yum soup and pad thai.  This place consistently serves great food, I will definitely be back.

oP3D5KpWTaXZ6hqi-QCfEg.text: Love the food here!  The restaurant is very clean and the workers are super nice.  I'm kind of a sissy and only go to #4-5 hot on the heat in the food.   Thanks for the great food!

xZHqafM30yrGtbP2PupKsg.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant and I am well familiar with many of the others. This is a gem of a family establishment with great food and a friendly and attentive staff. The Spicy Pad Ka Prao is the best in the city, Drunken Noodles and Pineapple Fried rice are exceptional. They are very attentive to special diets and vegan needs. Once there was a mix up in the spicy level of a dish and they addressed it quickly and happily. What more can you ask.

qTrzkNpehkfRjVlItfdfEQ.text: Eh! I'm not too impressed. The service was pretty blah and it didn't seem like they paid attention enough. Customers at the other tables appeared unhappy with the service. And another customer was having problems eating her food because it was so spicy. I ordered my spice level at a 1, so it wasn't spicy. The food was ok. I ordered the Crab Rangoon and it was absolutely delicious. And the Pad Thai was just ok but not bad at all, the portion size was nice. If I do come back, it would definitely be for more of the Crab Rangoon and will probably just get it to go.

Uf7LZ4XOiNmhqRWutwRu8A.text: Let me say, I've had many of thai from all around the world (100% full blooded Asian) Imagine my surprise and excitement when I found this hidden gem in Ross township! The food is by far one of the best thai restaurants I've had. My boyfriend believes it's comparable if not better than Nicky's Thai kitchen (which is very good as well).  Five stars for Red orchid for the delicious food, great service, consistent delivery of spice levels and ease of parking.

has2ePsAVtU-6-Kgyn1_RQ.text: Very nice people run this restaurant .  The food just isn't good.  I've tried several times and come away with feeling a need to write this review. I've benefited from reviews from this community.

cl3C4CXsA3IcDtTCl4vnXw.text: I stopped in here for lunch with my boyfriend the other day, and we really enjoyed our meals! It was a Saturday afternoon around lunch time, but it was pretty dead. Our food came out extremely fast!  We started with an order of crab rangoon, and I loved them. They're on the sweeter side, but not overly sweet. I got green curry with chicken with a spicy level 2 (out of 10). They take the spice pretty seriously here, so keep that in mind! It wasn't my absolute favorite curry I've tried, but it was still tasty. My boyfriend ordered the drunken noodles and they were really good too. I would definitely come here again to try some other options.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Free n Curry Dinner with chicken

KPMw-0x56R0oYk9bMOea0g.text: Tasty Thai! The sauces are full of flavor along with the heat. We ordered the combo appetizer sampler #1. I was super curious about their Red Orchid style bread. It was similar to a French toast but savory and deep fried. Crab rangoons were perfectly done, spring rolls and steamed dumplings were decent. I enjoyed the variety of sauces.   For the entree, we ordered the chicken Pad Thai and Phuket Crispy Noodles. Pad Thai was on par with others in the Pittsburgh area but the Phuket Crispy Noodles sauce was full of flavor! The seafood was slightly overdone for my taste but the everything else was perfect. I was in such a food coma, I forgot about dessert!  I got the Spicy Pork Basil Dinner to go and had a quick taste when I got home. Again, full of flavor and Pork was cooked well. I'd happily go back to this restaurant in a heartbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dining area
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red Orchid Red Orchid Combination Sampler 1
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Basil Dinner - Pork. Take out.

dwtD-RkM9IxttY2Y-o9faw.text: Equally delicious as eat in or take out. Spot on with ordered spicy levels where applicable. Love having this restaurant in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad see eaw

8KviiLU324-xanJwjdGNJw.text: Out working this week, our director wanted to find a thai place near our location. Overall it is a nice place, and their dishes were pretty tasty. I tried the crispy duck with tamarind sauce. Service was fast and the food tasty.   I'll definitely try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy duck with tamarind sauce

ItD52ODOYWABOguk_ZiV9A.text: Imagine our delight when we realized Red Orchid delivers!  YAHOO!    Perfect for a "ain't gonna budge off the couch rainy Sunday" dinner option.  We pulled up the YELP "order online" option and received our order delivered hot, fresh, within 30 minutes, and with a smile.  The driver will call you to let you know they have arrived which is another great feature of this service.  We ordered the Lad Nah Dinner which is stir fried wide rice noodles with broccoli, mushrooms, baby com, carrot, and topped with light gravy that was reminiscent of chicken gravy to be honest. The noodles sort of stick together a little bit because they deliver them in a separate box (which is thoughtful but they need some sauce or something so they don't turn into a big gelatinous mass of noodle).  Pretty good though I would order it spicier next time - bump it up to a three from a one spice level.  We also got some Yum Ma Kua which is grilled eggplant mixed with ground chicken, lettuce, red onion, scallion and tomato and comes with a spicy lime sauce and it is absolutely delicious.  It's the perfect balance of acidic lime and layers of spice.  The eggplant is on the mushy side but we loved it.     The Tom Kha Soup was very good too.  It's a soup made with coconut milk, flavored with galangal, lemongrass, mushroom, cabbage, carrots and it arrived garnished with fresh scallion and cilantro.  I ordered mine vegetarian but would recommend ordering chicken or shrimp next time.  It was a tad bland with just steamed veggies in it.   We also got an order of the Green Curry Dinner, a side of Steamed Mixed Vegetable, and for dessert, the Thai Pumpkin Custard.  Their Green Curry is sublime.  Truly.  Order some.  And the curry comes with fresh green beans and green pepper that are al dente and a great compliment to the spicy coconut milk curry sauce.   We really loved the pumpkin custard too but wished it was bigger but that's not a knock against the restaurant at all - we just loved it and wanted more!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delivery packaged nicely and still warm - (clockwise) Tom Kha Soup, Yum Ma Kha eggplant, Green Curry &amp; Lad Nah
Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin custard dessert

TXheDhs0k1iRgUpNOqnypQ.text: I love this place. There aren't too many Thai restaurants near by so this is my go to spot! It's nice because you can pick the level of spiciness for your meal. I usually get the 4. At first, it's quite tame but towards the end of the meal my mouth is usually on fire (note: my dad loves spicy food so he gets the 6 and said it's not too hot for him).   Although the service was slow at first, our waiter ended up redeeming himself before the end of the meal.   It's a cute little place. Would definitely recommend it if you want to try out some nice Thai in the area.

cL6Vqqetu7CB2C5GNql81g.text: Eaten here and gotten takeout multiple times. My favorite Thai food in the Pittsburgh area. They are flexible and can make most dishes vegan.

npEY8EbGgy6qeJRxHqE_lA.text: Very very good. Always gets the order right and always ready for pick up when you get there. Amazing staff.

8TPLp2ML6N7_ERuFxGBDLA.text: Definitely a good place to go if you're craving Thai and don't feel like making a trip to the city (for Smiling Banana Leaf, Nicky's Thai, or Thai Me Up) if you live in the North Hills. The flavors are there and if you like spice, you'll definitely be happy - I ordered a level 5 with the panang curry and the heat was higher than I expected...but I liked that). If you're not big on heat but want a little I'd probably suggest ordering a 2. We also had the potstickers which were really tasty - I probably could have eaten 6 more! :D  My only complaint is that the Panang Curry's consistency was more of a soup than a curry - I expect curry to be on the thicker side but this wasn't the case. Still tasty though! And I had plenty to take home afterwards. I'd probably order take out from here in the future.

Vp61fXFfAxUPNAmmYBzMBw.text: Really amazing Thai food. Le Thai Cafe is closer to our house and delivers to us, or we would probably eat here more!

xwoz8PSQuokF1xubmnxF_w.text: Loved it! We didn't have super high expectations and we're very pleasantly surprised by the authenticity of the food! Reminded us of being back in Thailand. We got the Tom Kha, Spicy Basil (shrimp), Papaya Salad (very spicy!!) And the Green Curry with chicken.  Would absolutely recommend if you're looking for a spot en route to/from the airport.

1VvDjKHBmWQ_ofE-xHniYw.text: Ordered takeout from GrubHub ... and unfortunately, I was disappointed in my meal. The food wasn't flavorful; it was rather bland. Also, extremely spicy for a level 4.   I won't be getting food from here again. Too many yummy Thai restaurants around.

3_IUWV7dN3xpmi9QMkPdFA.text: Love their mango sweet rice.   Things are on the spicy side of the scale.   Tried their chicken and pork curry on two occasions, both were overdone in my likings.

nvhgG5jOmCKG1mRl0eeEYw.text: I've heard the spice level at Red Orchid is a step higher than most other Thai restaurants and boy is that True! I usually order a 4 spice level at other Thai restaurants and that's usually not too spicy for me. I ordered a 4 here and my stomach was on fire afterwards.   Anyhow, the pad see eew was good. The sauce was on the thin side and had a distinct soy sauce flavor, but was balanced nicely with a subtle sweetness. The pad thai was sweet and a hint smoky. Also ordered a tom kha soup and I thought it was average, but still loaded with veggies, which was a plus.   I would definitely stop back in if ever I'm in the North Hills area. If a 10 spice level at other Thai restaurants isn't spicy enough for you, I highly recommend giving Red Orchid a try!

Yivxqb2OWOikOyU9oT38iA.text: Decent thai food. People are really friendly. The tom kah soup is a little salty, but delicious and creamy.

_wWobK31Ok1Wl11yTmhjrQ.text: I went to eat here with a group of people for lunch. It has good Thai food for a reasonable price. The serving sizes here I feel are for sharing. As a group, you should order several dishes and have a portion of each dish. I am very big on spicy foods and for most/All their dishes they have spice rating of 1-10 depending on your preference! I would definitely recommend this place!   I attached some photos with descriptions as well
