J6O7mhf31eTLuPOjMbJfRA.text: The restaurant is very clean and decorated well. Staff was very friendly. However the food was sub par. I got the Pad Thai with seafood. The seafood was all bland, watery or rubbery. The noodles were slightly over cooked. My fiance got the Thai Style Beef fries rice which he enjoyed. And the appetizer sampler #1 was perfect for the two of us. The price was the biggest thing that got us though. It was moderately pricey which was not expected.

ALzhxGo-xUgqxQVlH0vfwQ.text: Good Thai food. Normally use this place for takeout. They are really quick when preparing your order. Their curry is really good too. Decent size portions and the taste is exactly what I expected

UB0LTd5Oe9OSj7BU6i3OWQ.text: Such a great place for authentic Thai in the North Hills. They cater for my wife who has a gluten allergy and the service and fresh taste is outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tom Kha soup, made in the authentic way, tastes so good.

-vSYPL_8nQ5npChzhAkytA.text: I stopped here because I needed somewhere to watch soccer on my phone.  Walked in and the server was watching the game too. He recommended the spicy ground pork and veggies over rice with an egg on top. Nothing to compare it to, but it tasted great and I ate it all. A few too many peppers,  but otherwise a cacophony of goodness. We talked soccer and watched Germany lose. Good food and good times!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scrumptious

dPBWnbPJO7d1vDznjo7FoQ.text: Some of the best Thai food I've tried, and I've tried a lot! This is very authentic, flavorful and reasonably priced! Nice people too. Love their Pumpkin Curry, Drunken Noodles, Pad Kra Pao, Curry Fried Rice, and many more. Best Thai deal around. If they served larger portions of rice with the meals (especially the sticky rice) it would complete the experience!  Small seating area, not really set-up for large groups, but seating is usually available.  I have been a regular for some time, and always recommend this place highly to friends! Exceptional!

8w1Uf6EbvHzlwzNx-96Z8g.text: I'm new to the area and was looking for a good spot for Authentic Thai food. After reviewing their online menu, I was surprise to find both my favorite (hard to find) Thai dishes: pumpkin curry and papaya salad. My husband ordered pineapple rice and coconut soup. Everything was Great! Very authentic and not too spicy. We will be ordering again.

x513w9zr7Q9Q4JqYsec47Q.text: This is probably my favorite Thai place on east coast !!! The Lao papaya salad is amazing and the streamed fish in lime sauce is the bomb !!  I will return to Red Orchids every chance I get

ygXxKS5gRej0G8ntOmI8QQ.text: Love e food. Love the new atmosphere and expansion.  Can't wait to see if the menu makes some additions with the new space.

jblHoLUXm1prhQcANpSqsA.text: This is the best Thai restaurant in the area, hands down.  Everything is fresh and they don't skimp on the spices like other places I've been to.  Service is always fantastic.

H7cjRO09Wp7rJYQmk5UGww.text: Repulsed...I was highly upset when I ordered my food and got some bland noodles with some lumps of tofu on the side...it truly looked like food that would be served in a prison or some kind of institutionalized food.  I have come here before many times and was mostly pleased.  We were one of the only tables here and got the worse service.  Our server could have cared less if we stayed or left.  We actually left because she never came back to check on us, give me my food, or even leave us a check... So maybe I was in an institution....perhaps?  This really sucks because I was ecstatic that north hills had a Thai restaurant...now I have to drive all the way to Thai place in cranberry.

X1JgUbQnrLQcZjqAzlQ7Ag.text: Went there for my first time and got take out. I ordered a range of things, (combination appetizer, spicy basil fried rice, tom kha soup)  and they were all very good. I ordered a 5 out of 10 on the spicy range and it was pretty spicy, but still very good. I will definitely be back.

5olBRlpNivxxai9Poyq9Mg.text: I've been here several times and they are defiantly authentic...but if u order a 5 sometimes it's too hot And sometimes just right...

kahPy3JExQUU9Iyk2VI43A.text: I like Thai food, and I was told that the Red Orchid had the best nam tok (beef salad). I won't say it's the absolute best, but I was not disappointed. I appreciate the chef's willingness to use a lot of chili peppers. The service was excellent, as I went with a friend who's not a Thai food afficianado, and the waitress was patient and helpful. The location is not the greatest, but there's ample parking and a nice Indian grocery next door that's worth a visit.

WK1w_CcXPbqpZbVbFU2Ekw.text: First time eating here - we were in a hurry and needed somewhere to get food in the Wexford area. It was great! And ready for take out very quickly. They were very accomodating and knowledgeable about the gluten sensitivity of two people in our party. The pad kee mao was so good, with a nice balance of vegetables, noodles, and meat (chicken). It was spicier than I expected, in a tasty way. And one of my favorite desserts was the special - mango sticky rice, a hit with the whole family.

Re3LceChr2u-b5u0Qf8KMg.text: This place is tiny but you won't miss the neon red letters out front. We showed up around 6:30. My first impression when we walked in was, where are we going to sit? I found about a dozen tiny tables with very little space keeping them apart with a long bench up against the wall. The inside is not what you'd expect it to be, very modern and hip. Cute lamps above every table and lots of wood work that looked like it came from Thailand. Almost every table was taken, aside from three that had a reserved sign on them. The girl that received us removed the sign from one of the tables and sat us right away. As we were looking at the menu, people kept coming in, some where waiting for a table, some were ordering take out. I was thrilled, I knew we found the Thai gem of the North Hills. My husband ordered Thai Style Fried Rice and I had the Garlic entree, we also shared the Fresh Summer Rolls with tofu as an appetizer.  The appetizer was light, not enough for my hungriness so I couldn't wait to get my entree.  First time I go into a Thai place I like to order a typical dish, maybe because I want to compare it to other Thai restaurants. My dish was good, very good; it came with a side of white rice shaped as a heart. My husband wasn't so enthusiastic about his, he said it was plain; the rice was clean, it didn't taste over fried or greasy, but it needed a sauce. I didn't try it because I don't eat chicken. I give it a 3 stars because, although my dish was very good my husband's was not, and the place is too small. Regular size people may have a hard time getting past the opening between the tables to sit. I also could hear the conversation of the people's sitting next to us (you'll be that close to the table next to yours). Oh, and since it's BYOB we took two bottles of wine (one white and one red): $2.75 per bottle or per person, not sure.

auyL8LLpc54USPHnh4hFEA.text: Now I don't have to travel far for delicious thai food! I've been to Red Orchid three time for take out in the past two weeks. I have tried the drunken noodles, spicy green bean and panang curry. All three were delicious. I hope to try dinner sometime soon. The staff is super friendly and always willing to answer any questions.

BLh23RC_7pvr0noXEa5lCg.text: I am so excited to have good Thai without driving to North Side or Bellevue or farther.  The restaurant looks cute, not too stereotypical ethnic, not too take-out ish, not too duded-up. Just right, freshly decorated. Pretty small. BYOB.  I stopped for takeout in the middle of the afternoon and my order was ready in 10 minutes. They weren't busy at this in-between time. Service was fast and friendly.  The soup option that came with the lunch portion was Tofu that day and really delicious. It reminded me of chicken noodle soup but with added Thai spices and flavor and lots of black pepper. There weren't noodles but chunks of what tasted like fresh silky tofu. The lunch portion of Drunken noodles was excellent, lots of veggies, wide chewy rice noodles that were almost in chunks, tofu that tasted fresh - no stale oil flavor. I asked for very spicy and got what I'd consider a 5 though I appreciate that they'd rather be safe and not burn someone's mouth. The lunch portion was enough for me with the soup although I would have eaten more if there was more as it was that good. $7.50   The dinner portion of pad thai was a nice dinner portion - about the size you'd expect. The sauce was pretty good, not too sweet with a medium amount of spice (asked for 7 and it seemed more like a 4 to me but I like spicy). I'd call it much better than average Pittsburgh pad thai as I think average is usually too sweet and greasy and this was not. There was a bit more to the sauce than the traditional Thai thin sauce. $11  I can't wait to go back.

C5glhan49Sgvw7X1VDrxpQ.text: Pad Thai was very good. I like the noodles. I had another dish. It was good, but I would try to find something that would be my regular. This is a nice little restaurant. I will be back.

ajNfPNqntEm-oUWji7yslA.text: Best Thai ever. My mouth is watering a month later.   Best Service Ever.  So polite.  You can see in the kitchen and it is extremely clean.

Yo7-et0ZfmvN-4Wf_bMYYw.text: Small, quaint atmosphere - and a family run business.  If you are in the McCandless area north of the city, this is really one of the few Asian food options, and more importantly, one of the very few non-chain restaurants.  Appears to be a small family run business.  Good food, fast service, BYOB.  Tasty food.  I am particularly fond of the papaya salad (if you are not familiar, an unripened papaya, crunchy, spicy, a bit of fish sauce flavor).  It may sound odd, but the flavors are wonderful.  The spicy basil dishes were also quite good.  One thing I have found on my 3 visits there is that the spicyness level is a little inconsistent.  One of our 3/10 dishes tasted around an 8/10, and one of our 5/10 tasted like a 1/10.  This is an excellent option if you are in this area.  There is limited seating, tho - probably about 8 or 9 tables inside, and 2 tables outside.

fBDWGCXShSoBqqm4orAc-w.text: It is nice to finally have some authentic Thai food in the North Hills! The appetizers are alright, but the tom yum soup and dinners were delicious!  I have tasted the drunken noodles, panang curry, and chicken with mixed vegetables, and I would definitely order them again!   The prices are decent - $11 to $13.50 for most dinner entrees, and $7.50 to $9 for lunch.   It can be a little hard to find Red Orchid - it is on the corner plaza of 3 degree and babcock.  I am looking forward to many more authentic Thai meals.

ZB2qoxTvQxpzSlzIEX0DxA.text: Red Orchid has some of the best Thai. My wife and I have eaten there numerous times and have tried many dishes. Each one was exceptional. We highly recommend this restaurant!

AejlRZfA85sRFXPCXGsB3A.text: Love this place! Friendly staff, great food and no wimpy heat index. I've tried a few different things on their menu and all have been fantastic!

-lwKzm-5kqDx3F_JbhmYYg.text: Ate in restaurant once. Had takeout once. Food was delicious both times. Coconut soup and lemongrass soups were delicious, perfectly spiced. Beef with garlic entree on take out quite tasty, beef very tender, nice and hot (temperature) even for takeout!!. Thai basil chicken entree in restaurant perfectly spiced, but could have been warmer (temperature) when served (otherwise, red orchid would have received 5 stars from me instead of 4. Will definitely be a regular customer. Decor' is very comfortable!!

JkcEgsw3p73Y7YvPV9r45A.text: I will not come back to this restaurant anymore. Their service was super slow, and the waitress was kind of rude.The beef noodle soup I ordered was salty.

b-JPzIGMx_vs-QWN5pB9aQ.text: It's nice to have another local Thai option.  We were excited to try it.  Maybe we're just spoiled by the excellent offerings Downtown,  in Squirrel Hill,  Bloomfield etc.  Not terrible but just OK Thai food.  4 of us left all feeling "meh"  about it.  The only standout was the calamari,  and not in a good way.  $6.50 for 5 crunchy little rings that could have come from a frozen box next to the tater tots in the grocery store.  Not worth a dollar.  The rest was just ok.  But not good enough to bring us back for more.  2.5 stars.

ueDyPsNQawEhP0prrJPbrg.text: Red Orchid - what a nice addition to the fledgling restaurant scene in North Hills (NoHi really has no excuse for such a crappy restaurant scene, but I digress). On the way to my boyfriend's parents' house and we were starving. They live up north in the mountains so it's a little drive with almost no good options on the way. As we pass through NoHi anyway, we figured we'd finally try this place out.  It won't replace Smiling Banana Leaf or Nicky's Thai for me, but it's a solid option. I ordered the green curry with tofu, spice level 7. The tofu was nice and firm, which I loved. I can't stand when my tofu gets soggy. This dish was also nice and spicy. I may kick it down to a 6 next time ... though maybe not. It left my lips burning, but nothing I couldn't handle. Not like the time I ordered green curry, spice level 7 at Silk Elephant and thought my eyes were going to burn out of my head, tongue out of my mouth.  My biggest issue with the curry was that it was thick. It was purported to be made with coconut milk like normal, but there wasn't much of a coconut taste and, as I mentioned, it was really thick, not at all runny. Didn't like that. Also, it did not pack as much flavor as the aforementioned thai restaurants.  My boyfriend ordered the pad thai, his staple, and he said it was really tasty. My other problem with Red Orchid the day we went was the service. Super friendly but rather slow. We sat and waited for forever for someone to come take our orders and then bring us the check. That was disappointing. Not trying to turn anyone off from trying this place. If you're actively searching for thai food, I highly suggest Smiling Banana Leaf (Highland Park) or Nicky's Thai (Northside and Downtown) over here, but if you're in NoHi, there's not much out that way that tops this place.

NEFMZ1pOJJEQEc8Te7hHMw.text: We went on a Sunday night, I believe our 4th time here and the restaurant was very busy. The interior is very nicely decorated. The food and service were both very good. We asked for our food to be a 10 and it was served pretty hot unlike some other restaurants. Would recommend for the food. My complaint is a $5 corkage charge on a Sunday night and the glasses are just water goblets , not wine glasses. Competitors usually have no corkage and wine glasses. Was this review helpful? Yes | No

NuwKXU0lEP05-jnmGdiDmQ.text: It wasn't busy at all when we went during the week, so we were a little skeptical... but everything was absolutely delicious! The larb gai, drunken noodle, and spicy basil rice are our favorites. Haven't had their curry yet. Also, hot means hot here, so don't over do the heat. We always say 7, and we could hardly finish our meal here! 4 for now on lol

vuUz7R6va8pLwkOAuQDChg.text: Red Orchid offers excellent Thai food. They're not shy about spice if requested, the food is fresh and takeout is simple and convenient.

scvMxYB111ziLzBDZtKsFA.text: Finally made it here for the first time yesterday for lunch. I went with my co worker at 11:30 and we were the first ones there. The parking was convenient and the inside was very nice. Big, colorful lights with fresh flowers on each table. I ordered the Pad Phet with beef, onions, peppers, carrots, green beans and bamboo shots with a spice level of 8. Food came out about 7 minutes after we ordered. It was very flavorful and authentic. Had just the right amount of spice for me even though I typically do 10. It came with steamed jasmine rice in a heart shape. I would get this dish again, but I'm shooting for the red curry next time. My co worker got the cashew chicken with a 0 spice level. She said it was very tasty. We were in and out in an hour. Very relaxing atmosphere. The place is very comparable to Nicky's. I probably give Nicky's the slight edge because their presentation of entrees are a little better looking and the food is a bit spicier. I will definitely return to Red Orchid and it's even better it's so close to where I live and work.

zzf2ucxn0RvPXBxhjtKCcQ.text: Overall good.  Wild curry tofu was not coconut based- this was good for a change. The lad nah was good- noodles were thick and tasty. However, the pad Thai was sub par. Service wasn't bad either.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Orchid - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai Iced Tea- Yum!

IiNpPLlsPntHVBf1sHg-Og.text: Simply fantastic!  Every new dish I try amazes me all over again.  Drunken noodles, pad thai, thai fried rice, green curry, red curry and my newest favorite Cashew Chicken have all been delicious.

nct45JE96DI-P9630FPDSg.text: The two most important men in my life are on a very serious Thai food kick recently which has lead me to places I wouldn't have made a second glance at before.  I work with my dad, so his cravings sometimes get the best of him when I ask him "What are we doing for lunch today?" and he asks me to find a place close to Wexford to satisfy his Thai tooth.  We tried Red Orchid today.  It was a little far from our office, but I think it will be a place we frequent when he's in the mood because there aren't any others in the area that I feel are worth trying.  I placed an online order today for 4 of us and paid mind to other reviewers' comments that said their spicy is REALLY spicy.  We ordered 2 chicken pad Thai at levels 3 and 4, pumpkin curry at level 3 and I got the Lad Nah at a level 1 because I didn't feel like sweating through my shirt today at the office.  The online ordering feature is very convenient and you can specify what level of spiciness you want as well as pick a time for pickup.  They do not offer delivery.  Our order was ready when it said it would be.  The food was really good! They do lunch or dinner portion sizes.  I could eat the lunch portion for dinner and have a full meal for $7.50!  I was told the chicken pad Thai was very good and that the noodles tasted fresh.  I really enjoyed my Lad Nah and especially liked the fact that they put the noodles on the side for me to add to the dish.  The pumpkin curry was good (I'm not huge on curry but its my dads favorite dish), but he said he preferred Pusadee's pumpkin curry to Red Orchid.  Service was as decent as it can be for an online takeout order, but it was ready when it said it would be.  The food, like I said, was very good.  However, I didn't eat it and say "OMG THIS IS AMAZING" the way I have at a couple other places (see other reviews) and so that's why I didn't give it a full 5.  I am sure we will be back, though :)

kb8rvks8RjBnfs8PtgTEqA.text: This is really more of a 3.5 star review, but the food was just about good enough that I'd rather it show up as 4 than 3.  We recently moved further north; why, I don't know. Well, I do, but I'd rather have moved back to Bloomfield. Since I couldn't get that, I was pleased to discover that at least there was a Thai place nearby. Thai is one of my favorite cuisines of all; I love the balance of flavors, the heat, the SOUP! I was chagrined to learn they don't offer delivery; we went with takeout, instead. Presumably you can order on their website, but it's never worked properly for me. I used the old-fashioned method of picking up the phone.  For our first foray at Red Orchid, we chose a tom kha soup with chicken; larb; and shrimp pad thai. My husband is still new to Thai food, somehow, so it seemed best to have a "safe" noodle option for him. Plus I love pad thai. So there. I ordered everything at a 5 on a 1-10 spicy scale, figuring I'd adjust going forward.  The tom kha soup was rich with coconut milk, perhaps... too rich. I never thought I'd say that, but it about overwhelmed the other flavors. It still tasted pretty good but I wished there was a little more of the lemongrass broth and a little less coconut. I actually didn't finish it. This was disappointing, since this soup, done perfectly, is my "if you could only eat one thing for the rest of your life" thing.  Undeterred, I moved on to sample the pad thai. It was good and had tangy flavor, plenty of egg bits (bonus points), and the noodles weren't overcooked. Several of the shrimp tasted slightly off; it WAS a Monday, but still. A 5 wasn't terribly spicy in this case; I'd have liked a little more piquantry on my plate. Overall, it was about on the same level as, say, Thai Cuisine in Bloomfield. I like Thai Suan Thip's best in Pittsburgh.  The larb, though... o, larb. This meat salad is a thing of glory, redolent of fish sauce and lime juice and (in this case) mint. It's so fresh and so clean, and I adore it. Red Orchid's is served over cut lettuce, rather than with leaves to wrap it, which is just fine by me. Plenty of dressing/sauce, and the spice level here was perfect. Just thinking about it makes me wish I were eating it right now.  The portions were generous, with the above making a perfect-sized dinner for a ravenous pregnant woman and a large adult male. The prices are about on par with other Thai establishments in the city, with Thai Suan Thip remaining the high price point outlier (but the food is so good!).   Definitely good enough to go back fairly often; not good enough to knock any restaurants out of the running for top Thai.

l0C8ktfIN1kbXLX5TEUWow.text: After reading the reviews, I came here for my birthday dinner.  It was everything I had hoped for.  We could hear the roar of the wok and the smell of sauteed garlic filled the air.  You must have Thai Tea as a beverage, as it is delicious!!  All of the curry and noodles are super tasty.  They are happy to accommodate your spice tolerance if you are a 0 or a 10.  Service was great!!  Thank you Red Orchid for a great family dinner!!

GHePDFVwEtLqs11IqGBEUw.text: Lovely! The decor is wonderful, more than I was expecting. The food was FABULOUS! I had the yellow curry, number 2 which was still decently spicy but I don't mind. It was fantastic, and I love that it is served with jasmine rice. I had the tofu soup for an appetizer and must have eaten it in one minute flat. Will definitely be coming back asap!

DE3Yyj5-OEdKih-AudytBA.text: Excellent food! Very friendly staff and great curry too! I like this place better than Nicky's on the northside, it's definitely close but I give the edge here. Fast take out and great menu! Will be back!

WbmiRjkRzYToPkvXv-CJNQ.text: Cute place great food with a bite that will knock your pants off. If you like Thai food and you like spicy come eat here they make it with as little or much spice as you can handle. We will be back  this is s place you don't wanna pass by

CIvj3ZuAZ-11-dmW6rFBxw.text: Went to Red Orchid last night with friends and it was outstanding.  We love Thai and have tried it everywhere - this is now our favorite Thai restaurant.  Started off with Tom Yum soup, which was great.  I had Red Curry Land and loved it.  As noted in other reviews, it was spicier than what other restaurants might serve, but it was just right for me - great combination of flavors.  Dessert was a special for the night that was spectacular.  (Don't know how to pronounce it, much less spell it.). Definitely want to try the pumpkin custard or custard with sticky rice next time.  Portions were very generous and the service was excellent.  We'll definitely be back and have already recommended to friends.

NoA236IU2uu4MI0s4kNxJg.text: The BEST!!!!!! I order takeout from here on average once a week.  Food is always spot on and delicious!! They never mess up my order and it's always perfect.  Best Thai in the city no doubt!  Their new expansion is beautiful.  Employees are always so friendly.  Can't say enough good things!

wCMrHFGRTpzBSrcSXPK-pg.text: great food, great service!! very authentic. spice scale hotter than most Thai restaurants in pgh area...

FO8zySi-px9U-H-n-hfEaw.text: I frequent this place because it is soo good. I have turned many coworkers into Thai fans in the process! The duck noodle soup and drunken noodles are probably my favorite dishes! Never failing on my spice addiction!  The crab rangoons are also a yummy way to start a meal! Very small inside so if you have a group it's best to order take out.

wViBCT4M-ruHmQcoajtWmA.text: omgoodness, this place is wonderful!  They were very busy and the timing of everything was a bit off, but the food was incredible.  We had the ginger shrimp, pumpkin curry and seafood special. The coconut soup was the best I ever tasted at a Thai restaurant. The desserts were so tasty! The only issue was with my husband's tofu dish, the tofu was pretty tough, but no matter we will definitely be back!!!
